Module Robotinterface
Package robotinterface.invkin

Class MotorConfiguration

java.lang.Object
robotinterface.invkin.MotorConfiguration
public class MotorConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
The result of inverse kinematics computations: the servo angles and motor lengths to reach a certain position.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    MotorConfiguration​(Motor[] motors, double[] values)
    Create a motor configuration.

  • Constructor Details

    • MotorConfiguration

      public MotorConfiguration​(Motor[] motors, double[] values)
      Create a motor configuration.
      Parameters:
      motors - array of controllable motors
      values - motor values

  • Method Details

    • values

      public double[] values()
      The values required to reach the position.
      Returns:
      motor values

    • setTargetValues

      public double setTargetValues()
      Set all computed angles to the servos and lengths to linear motors. The default speed is used for all servos and motors. This means, the different motions will not terminate simultaneaously.
      Returns:
      computed seconds the latest servo or motor to fulfill movement

    • setTargetValues

      public double setTargetValues​(double relativeToMaximum, double minSeconds, boolean exceptionOnNoFlexibleSpeed)
      Set all computed angles to the servos and lengths to linear motors. The speeds are automatically adjusted in such a way that all servos and motors reach the target angle or distance in the same time.
      Parameters:
      relativeToMaximum - relative speed to the maximum for the servo or motor with largest move (≤1.0)
      minSeconds - minimal time for the movement in seconds; i.e. reduce the speed, if the movement with the given relative speed would finish earlier
      exceptionOnNoFlexibleSpeed - if one of the servos or motors does not support flexible speed, throw an exception, otherwise use default speed (then not all motors fulfull the movement at the same time)
      Returns:
      computed seconds for all servos and motors to fulfull movement

    • setTargetValues

      public double setTargetValues​(double seconds, boolean exceptionOnNoFlexibleSpeed)
      Set all computed angles to the servos and lengths to linear motors. The speeds are automatically adjusted in such a way that all servos and motors reach the target angle or distance in the same time.
      Parameters:
      seconds - desired seconds to fulfull movement
      exceptionOnNoFlexibleSpeed - if one of the servos or motors does not support flexible speed, throw an exception, otherwise use default speed (then not all motors fulfull the movement at the same time)
      Returns:
      computed seconds for all servos and motors to fulfull movement, may be longer than the passed seconds, when motor speed limits are exceeded

    • dump

      public void dump()
      Dump the motor settings to console.
